main_definition: Been is the past participle of the verb 'to be' used in various idiomatic expressions to denote a state or condition previously experienced.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicates a period that has already passed
meanings_and_examples.example: I have been sick for two weeks.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in the passive voice to describe an experience or change
meanings_and_examples.example: She has been promoted since last year.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Signifies a past action that was completed before another action
meanings_and_examples.example: He finished his homework and then went out with friends, having been done for hours.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in expressions to describe life experience or familiarity with something
meanings_and_examples.example: I have been there; I know how it feels.
